Compensation_GradeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Compensation_GradeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Compensation_GradeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Compensation_Grade_Data.description: The ID for the compensation grade.  This is the index for the compensation grade and will be autopopulated if left blank.
The effective date of this salary grade.  We recommend using a date of 1900-01-01.  If not date is supplied, today's date will be used.
The unique salary grade name. Salary grades provide the guidelines for employee's base compensation.

validation.validation: The Compensation Grade Name entered has already been used.

Compensation_Grade_Data.description: The description of this salary grade.

Compensation_Grade_Data.description: The compensation elements that define base bay for this compensation grade.

Condition_RuleObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Compensation_Grade_Data.description: The compensation eligibility rules associated with this compensation grade.

Compensation_Pay_Range_Data.description: Number of Pay Range Segments can be specified as 3,4, or 5.
The minimum of the salary range.

validation.validation: The Minimum must be less than or equal to the Maximum for Compensation Grade - [grade name].

Compensation_Pay_Range_Data.description: The midpoint of the salary range.
The maximum of the salary range.
The spread from the range minimum to range maximum.
The top value for Segment 1.

validation.validation: The Minimum value must be less than or equal to the Segment 1 Top value for Compensation Grade - [grade name].
The Segment 1 Top value must be less than or equal to the Segment 2 Top value for Compensation Grade - [grade name].

validation.validation: The Segment 2 Top value must be less than or equal to the Segment 3 Top value for Compensation Grade - [grade name].

validation.validation: The Segment 3 Top value must be less than or equal to the Segment 4 Top value for Compensation Grade - [grade name].

validation.validation: The Segment 4 Top value must be less than or equal to the Segment 5 Top value for Compensation Grade - [grade name].

validation.validation: Salary Plan Reference must be specified for compensation grades or grade profiles containing a step definition.

Compensation_Pay_Range_Data.description: Specifies if the amount in the compensation steps can be overriden when assigned to an employee.

Compensation_Step.description: If True is entered, the Step will be removed from this Grade or Grade Profile as of the effective date.

validation.validation: The compensation step, [step], is in use and cannot be deleted.
validation.description: If a Compensation Step has ever been assigned to an employee it cannot be deleted.

Compensation_StepObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Compensation_StepObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: Compensation step, [step], already belongs to the [current_profile] profile and can't be added to the [new_profile] profile.
Compensation step, [step], already belongs to the [current_grade] grade and can't be added to the [new_grade] grade.

Compensation_Step_Data.description: The ID for the compensation step.  This is the index for the compensation step and will be autopopulated if left blank.
The effective date of an update to a Comp Step.  If an effective date is not provided, the effective date for the compensation grade will be used or current processing date will be used.
The progression interval to the next step (i.e. 1, 2, 10)

Typically the geographic salary ranges associated with the grade.
The description for the grade profile (typically geographic).
